data.content:
Anh - Anh
comfrey
['kʌmfri]
■ noun (plural comfreys) a plant with large hairy leaves and clusters of purplish or white bell-shaped flowers. [Symphytum officinale and related species.]
Origin
ME: from Anglo-Norman Fr. cumfirie, based on L. conferva, from confervere 'heal' (referring to the plant's medicinal use).

sentences.en: Comfrey seems to have been a remedy for all ills.
sentences.vi: Thảo dược dường như là phương thuốc cho mọi bệnh tật.
